
## Data

The credit data used in this project includes both categorical and quantitative data.   

Categorical variables include  

* Gender: Female or Male
* Student: Yes or No
* Married: Yes or No, and
* Ethnicity: African, American, Asian, or Caucasian

Quantitative variables are  

* Income
* Limit
* Rating
* Cards: Number of Credit Cards
* Age
* Education(years), and
* Balance

Distribution of quantitative variables is shown below in Figure 1.

```{r histograms, echo = FALSE}
library(png)
library(grid)
library(gridExtra)

Age_H <-  rasterGrob(as.raster(readPNG("../images/histogram-Age.png")), interpolate = FALSE)
Cards_H <-  rasterGrob(as.raster(readPNG("../images/histogram-Cards.png")), interpolate = FALSE)
Educ_H <-  rasterGrob(as.raster(readPNG("../images/histogram-Education.png")), interpolate = FALSE)
Income_H <-  rasterGrob(as.raster(readPNG("../images/histogram-Income.png")), interpolate = FALSE)
Limit_H <-  rasterGrob(as.raster(readPNG("../images/histogram-Limit.png")), interpolate = FALSE)
Rating_H <-  rasterGrob(as.raster(readPNG("../images/histogram-Rating.png")), interpolate = FALSE)

grid.arrange(Income_H, Limit_H, Rating_H,
				Cards_H, Age_H, Educ_H, widths=c(0.3, 0.7),
             ncol = 2)
```
